q: ' heads off, young civilians took it upon themselves to save the priceless artifacts by grabbing batons and surrounding the building to keep anything from being stolen. Cops later arrived and locked the area down. Egyptian citizens tried to prevent them and were joined by the tourism police, but some[ looters] managed to enter from above and they destroyed two of the mummies, Zahi Hawass said. The museum was still in danger yesterday, however. A building next door which houses the offices of President Hosni Mubarak 's ruling party was on fire and about to collapse. "

What: Barbara Walters , who had her own surgery to repair a faulty heart valve last year, addresses heart disease and the fear many have of a heart operation in A Matter of Life and Death. She talks to former Bill Clinton , David Letterman , Robin Williams and Regis Philbin , celebrities who've had heart surgeries. She also talks to doctors, including her own, about prevention and the warning signs of heart trouble.
